pullRequest.title: GEODE-6819: Fix PartitionedRegionSingleHopDUnitTest BindExceptions
pullRequest.bodyText:
Intermittent failures were caused by trying to stop and then restart
server(s) with the previously used ports which are no longer free on
the host machine.
This PR overhauls all of PartitionedRegionSingleHopDUnitTest while
also fixing flaky failures caused by underlying BindExceptions in both:

testMetadataIsSameOnAllServersAndClients
testSingleHopWithHAWithLocator

I've added comments below that point to the actual BindException
fixes to aid in reviewing.

nodes.bodyText:
dunitrunner revealed that testMetadataIsSameOnAllServersAndClients fails intermittently with underlying BindExceptions thrown when restarting server in vm0 or vm1 with the same port those two vms used to have a CacheServer running on.
The only way to fix this is to use a Locator in the pool instead of hardcoded server ports, and allow the CacheServers to come back up on any port.

dunitrunner revealed intermittent failures in testSingleHopWithHAWithLocator with an underlying BindException as the cause.
The easiest fix is to change startLocator to use port zero and then return whatever port the Locator ended up binding to.

commit.message:
GEODE-6819: Fix PartitionedRegionSingleHopDUnitTest BindExceptions

Intermittent failures were caused by trying to stop and then restart
server(s) with the previously used ports which are no longer free on
the host machine.

afterCommit.message:
GEODE-6819: Fix PartitionedRegionSingleHopDUnitTest BindExceptions

Intermittent failures were caused by trying to stop and then restart
server(s) with the previously used ports which are no longer free on
the host machine.

nodes.bodyText:
dunitrunner revealed flaky failures in testClientMetadataForPersistentPrs caused by underlying BindExceptions.
The fix involves pointing the client at the servers via the locator and then let the servers use whatever ports they can find instead of restarting the servers with a previously used port.
